question: In the Budget-2018, the Finance Minister announced for setting up two Defence Industrial Corridors in India. Which of the following are the proposed locations for the two corridors?
option1: First one is between Chennai and Bengaluru & second one is in the Bundelkhand region of Uttar Pradesh
option2: First one is between Kharagpur and Vijayawada & second one is in the Mewar region of Rajasthan
option3: First one is between Mumbaiâ€“Ahmedabad & second one on the Eastern coast of Odisha and Andhra Pradesh
option4: First one is between Udhana-Palsana & second one is on the Malabar coast of India
answer: First one is between Chennai and Bengaluru & second one is in the Bundelkhand region of Uttar Pradesh
explanation: The government has announced setting up two defence industrial corridors in the country to promote domestic production in both public and private sectors and boost investments in the production of defence armaments. The first of the two has been proposed to be set up between Chennai and Bengaluru- connecting Kattupalli port, Chennai, Tiruchi, Coimbatore and Hosur. The second has been proposed to be set up in Bundelkhand region of Uttar Pradesh.
